jobDescription: The University of Southern California (USC) is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to support the Office of Professionalism and Ethics (OPE). Reporting directly to the Vice President of Professionalism and Ethics, the Sr. Data Analyst will be responsible for performing high-level data analysis of complaints reported to the OPE, and provide recommendations and conclusions gained from analyzing such data.  The Sr. Data Analyst will also assist in the development of policies, procedures and guidelines/best practices for conducting investigations at the university, and will ensure that the foregoing duties are carried out in compliance with state and federal laws on workplace privacy. Additional/Specific Accountabilities Include:Perform data analysis of complaints and subsequent investigations, including interpretation of results and identification of trends using investigation tracking software and other programs, as necessary.Identify notable patterns and concerns regarding numbers of complaints and investigations, types, common issues and potential risks.Maintain knowledge of university-wide systems and processes, recommending enhancements and training opportunities, as needed. Ensure accuracy and compliance of data reporting systems and the tracking software, both conforming to university and industry standards.Supervise junior data analysts performing data input of complaint and investigation cases. Track completion and necessary follow-up of complaints and investigations managed and monitored by OPE, and assist with maintaining OPE’s anonymous and confidential hotline for additional complaint reporting.Prepare and maintain comprehensive reports as requested by OPE’s Vice President or Director. Performs other related duties as assigned or requested. The university reserves the right to add or change duties at any time. The Ideal Candidate Will Have:Master’s degree or J.D.; Bachelor’s degree (minimum) in business administration, legal studies, finance, auditing or similar ethics and compliance education.Five or more years’ experience in managing and analyzing complex data related to investigations, including the ability to identify trends.Demonstrated skills in collaboration, critical analysis, problem solving and discretion.Demonstrated attention to detail, and administrative/project management skills.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Proficient with Microsoft Office and investigation software.
